standard_abilities.description: When your health is below 20%, you can make two moves in a row.
You have basic healing abilities. Heal a party member for d10 health.
Once per day, You can use an aura which reinvigorates their comrades.
Given a few hours, you can repair most steel made items.
When dealing with minerals or works made of stone, your character's intelligence is treated as Masterful.
You can see well in the dark.
Elves can go days without sleeping, allowing them to keep watch long into the night.
You can influence men and halflings with their beauty.
You have incredible endurance.
Your character carries a sling, with which they are uncannily accurate.
Your is an are naturally talented chef, and food that they cook restores extra health..
You recover full health from sleeping in a real bed.
You are naturally good at sneaking.
When hunting, You have high perception..
You can unleash a mighty bellow to intimidate your foes.
You can eat raw meat without penalty.
You are naturally adept at climbing.
Catterwol are naturally good at fishing.
You have retractable, razor sharp claws.
Catterwol can survive long falls.
Once per day, a you can go into a rage, increasing strength and vitality but decreasing intelligence and perception.
You have a higher chance to intimidate enemies.
You can throw anything.
You have a chance of hitting an enemy so hard it demoralizes others.
You are a skilled hunter by necessity.
You can swap your dexterity and strength stats while on horseback.
You are apt at traversing the wilds.
Given a few hours, you can usually produce herbal remedies for ailments.
You can swap your dexterity and strength stats while on horseback.
You have been forced to learn to sleep anywhere without penalty, and can build shelters quickly.
Hit two enemies that are standing in a row.
Once per battle, you can attack with a guaranteed critical hit.
Your charisma is increased when speaking with a kingsman.
Once per day and during battle, add 1 attack to each teammate per point of your inner fire.
You can bridge the gap between yourself and a mid-distance foe.
At the penalty of their next turn, you can use your shield to defend party members behind you.
You can choose whether to apply +1 to Dexterity or Strength.
Once per day, you can enchant a physical weapon with elemental effects.
You can naturally dual wield magic and physical weapons.
Once per day, conjure a vial of explosive liquid. d10 AOE damage
You are gifted a never ending satchel.
You are capable of impressing guards and villagers.
You can summon a hut big enough for two.
A few times a day, a you can turn something into something else.
You can use your magic to impress and intimidate creatures with lower intelligence.
When you are in dire trouble, your luck vastly increases.
Nature itself often aids you in your travels. (Increased Perception in the wilds)
You start with a wizard's staff.
Once per day, you can heal all party members for 120% health. Does not stack.
Once per battle, you can use your magic to make all enemies in an area attack you exclusively.
You have increased luck when fighting against the undead.
You can create potions and draughts from items in your environment.
You can easily fashion disguises to hide yourself with.
You are naturally good at sneaking. Stacks with Padfoot.
You have a higher chance of not being discovered when stealing.
You can see in low light.
You are an adept climber
You begin with a sword-breaker and 100 feet of rope.
You begin with extra gold.
You begin well equipped.
You hold sway with town guards and villagers in your parent's territory.
A your father is sure to have holdings in many of the towns and villages of the realm.
Your presence increases party cheer in good weather, and decreases it in bad weather.
Once per battle, you can play dead for a turn, avoiding further injury.
Peasants and town guards everywhere love and respect you.
You can use their beauty to sway the minds of others. (+3 charisma when speaking to people attracted to their sex)
You are good at dodging and countering.
You gain +2 Charisma when speaking with people of low birth. -4 for people of high birth.
Choose between Smith(+1 strength, -1 intelligence), Hunter (+1 dex, -1 strength, bow), Tavern Owner (+1 Charisma, -1 Strength, -1 Dex, more gold),  fletcher, or farmer.
You can't be easily controlled or manipulated by intelligence based spells.
You are good at digging.
You have high dexterity, and can naturally turn flips and cartwheels.
You have mastery over an instrument of your choice, and begin with it.
You are a master with throwing knives, and carry many in your sleeves.
You can gather information from the children of a town.
You begin with a longbow.
Once every three turns, you can take a shot with a huge accuracy bonus.
Once per engagement, you can shoot two arrows at a time.
You have incredible vision.
If enemies are in a row and close enough, a your shot will pass right through them.
Given the right materials, you can make their own arrows.
Huntsmen get more meat  and materials from butchering a kill.
You are uncannily accurate in dense environments.
You begin with a shortbow.
You can choose to aim for an opponent's knees with increased accuracy.
You are adept at setting traps.
You are a master of your body.
You are deadly with just their hands.
Being in your presence can help put others at ease/boost morale.
You are more likely to detect spiritual energy.
You can restore their health more quickly by meditating.
You can share in the ability of another member of the party.
You can choose one of the four elements to have power over.
You are in it for the long haul, and take longer to tire than others.
You are learned, and know many languages and locales.
You have a deep knowledge of the land in which you are in.
You begin with a kite shield.
You sometimes limp from an old arrow wound. For some reason, this increases the morale of their party.
You have a deep understanding of the limits of your bodies and of others.
You begins his adventure with a rusted set of armor and a sword. Causes tetanus.
You have an increased ability to feint in battle.
You can learn almost anything in a tavern.
Once per area, you can summon an old friend.
